cons: No intensivist for the day shift. No ability to easily access physicians without PAs or NPs on a patients case.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Hollywood, CA
pros: Some of the staff is nice and willing to help, and that’s the only upside to working here.
cons: Nurses treat you like trash, the hospital is filthy, dirty, disgusting, nursing supervisors gossip and talk about new hires, staff are coming in 1-2 hours late daily without any repercussions, training is minimal if at all, you don’t know who’s a supervisor because there isn’t any leadership. Everyone just does what they want. The way these ppl talk to these patients is wild and I wouldn’t put my animal in here for care. Doctors are rude and there are LOTS of mental health patients that can and will assault staff.

job_title: in Culver City, CA
pros:
The lab staff are awful. The management shows blantant favoritism and racial preferences. Management does not hold the lab staff accountable for mistakes much farther than a slap on the wrist, even though in my time here, there have been mistakes made by lab staff that resulted in patient death. Many of the phlebotomists are VERY unskilled and have little to no drive for improvement. There are even employees, techs, and nurses that brag about how irresponsible they can be in the place because of "how hard it is to actually get fired".
I feel bad for inpatients at the hospital and urge anyone considering this as a place of employment or healthcare to look elsewhere. Please look at other reviews of this place and take the negative ones seriously.
This place need an entire restructuring from the very top of administration, all the way down to management.
cons: The entire hospital is a Con. there are very few good or redeemable qualities.

review_title: Nice jobs to step in the surgery scene

review_title: A Steppingstone don't get stuck here
job_title: Mental Health Worker in Culver City, CA
pros: Depending on your director you can have pretty good flexibility with your schedule.
cons:
You have a yearly review and no matter how good your review is, you don't get a raise unless your union is negotiating new contracts with the company so whatever amount you start at is where you will stay unless the union fights for more or you advance into a higher job position.

Also this company is good for finding ways to not pay incentives to all employees that it originally promised when needing people to come in to work extra days/weekends

review_title: Coworkers are great, management is terrible
job_title: Registered Nurse in Los Angeles, CA

cons: Management is terrible. All equipment is decades old. There’s not enough IV pumps. The outlets on the walls are broken. The TV and lights are shared with 2 patients in a double room. Management doesn’t care about employee retention. Half the nurses are travelers/registry. Half of the staff are new grads.

job_title: LVN in Van Nuys, CA

review_title: Cant even describe this hellhole of place to work!
job_title: Per Diem RN in Culver City, CA
pros: Very good location, some CNA's I have worked with are very helpful.
cons:
- During the orientation, although the nurse educator was very sweet and was trying her best, most of the time she didn't know what she was talking about. Fortunately, most people that got hired and was attending the class were experienced nurses. Even during orientation you can tell that staff morale is really bad because almost all the educators were on leave and the only one available is already looking forward to her other job.
- I had to come to work super early just to save myself a working computer. Once I came 30 mins early to save myself a working "COW", another RN told me that its her computer because she was using it yesterday. %^&*U****%$$!!
-They have the worst EHR and Medication dispensing system (that seemed to be broken every day.
-80% of the staff that is working here are travelers.
-Fights between staff are a norm. Like a charge nurse literally shouting at one of the nurses in the middle of the nurse's station.
-You literally have to do everything for the doctors including having to hound them and waste your time paging them the whole day. You have to put every single order for the doctors.
-I was hired with 2 other RN's who were offered almost $15k new hire bonus, but they still left after 2 mos because of the horrendous working conditions.

job_title: Caregiver, CNA in Culver City, CA
pros: leaving at the end of the shift
cons: Ppl don't come to work ALWAYS short handed, dirty, unprofessional lazy rude people.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Van Nuys, CA
pros: Easy to get hired. That's literally the only pro.
cons: I have worked a wide variety of jobs and this has by far been the worst I've ever had. No one is a team player, everyone only looks out for themselves. Everyone is fake and no one is trustworthy. They like to get others in trouble if possible . This place only cares about money. They do not care about the patients or their employees. They do not even have a proper A/C system in place and have a huge lack of supplies. The pay is low, the benefits suck, and absolutely everyone has a bad attitude. Even management is sleeping with other employees. So unprofessional. This place is literally hell on earth. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place all together if you can.

job_title: Staff RN in Culver City, CA
pros: Unfortunately none... seriously  :(
cons: Extremely disorganized hospital. The Staff is rude, the Aides are mean as hell, and the RNS are encouraged to do CNA and RN job or else they will be bullied by the Aides. There's no culture of respect and team work. Verbal fights break out everyday. Computers don't work and homeless patients are kicked out in the street daily. The patients are mostly drug seeking homeless and there's no culture of teaching. Inservices are never given and staff can't barely take lunch break. Elevators don't work well either. Doctors don't put orders in and talk down on nurses.

job_title: Mental Health Worker in Van Nuys, CA
pros: Co-workers make this place bearable, but eventually you just have to go.
cons: Management cares not for staff or patients, just profits. Dangerously understaffed,and at times, overworked. Pay sucks. Medical benefits are expensive and terrible. Schedules blow.  How this place doesn't get fined or shut down boggles the mind.

job_title: Director in Culver City, CA
pros: Great hard-working team members trying to make things work with NO money.
cons: Turnover is horrible.  CEOs, CNOs, and Department Directors are constantly being hired and fired.  Hard to do your job when management can't get themselves together.

job_title: Administrative Director in Culver City, CA
pros: My boss has been very supportive of me. Very accommodating of my requests.  The support has been great from the Executive Management. My COO Shana is an awesome boss and will let you work independently for as long as you take care of your departments. She helps eliminate the barriers and ensure that you are successful on what you do.
cons:
No match for the retirement benefits.
The medical benefits could be better.
